byline.original: By VINDU GOEL and MIKE ISAAC

abstract: LinkedIn shares plunge as much as 25 percent in after-hours trading due to dissapointing second-quarter report; follows similarly dramatic drop-offs at Twitter and Yelp; trend may indicate that Wall Street is tiring of financial missteps by some of its Internet darlings, and raises question of whether social media companies will truly be able to maintain growth rates that justify their outsize valuations.
lead_paragraph: The performances illustrate the way investors are questioning whether social media companies can keep their growth rates vigorous enough to justify their valuations.

headline.main: Social Media Punished as Results Fall Short
headline.print_headline: Social Media Punished as Results Fall Short

snippet: The performances illustrate the way investors are questioning whether social media companies can keep their growth rates vigorous enough to justify their valuations.
